page.title: 16Religion.
page.content: Newport is very lucky, as it has three different places where people can go to worship.The largest is the Church of England church.This is a large brick buiding, erected in the last century.It has a spire and a bell tower with eight bells. The vicar,Rev. Robinson, says that it cost Â£160 a week to keep the church heated and in good repair.There are about fifty worshippers each weekend. In the centre of the village, there is a Methodist chapel,dating from the last century.Most of the buildings date from the 1800's when Newport began to develop, following the cutting of the canal to drain the land,and make housing possible. The third place of worship is a small chapel, situated at the eastern end of the village.The people who are Roman Catholics worship here.
